title: Ticket #3827: Scalability problems when condor_qedit'ing many jobs
description:
LIGO is reporting that the schedd completely hangs for 5+ minutes when doing a condor_qedit on many running jobs.

On a schedd running 2,000 jobs, the command 

condor_qedit -const 'jobstatus==1' FooTest False

Will cause the schedd to completely hang in D state for at least 3 minutes. Seems like it is writing the user log entries for the updated attributes.
remarks:
2013-Aug-07 14:29:46 by pfc:
Another instance of what I think is the same fundamental issue, this time at UWM: 

On 08/07/2013 05:33 PM, Adam Mercer wrote:

Hi

With Tom away this week we're all trying to fill in with support issue
at UWM, this morning one of the head nodes (pcdev1) is very slow due
to a user running a lot of jobs that are waiting for io. I've
identified the user that is running these jobs and am trying to put
their jobs on hold. When I try this I receive the following:

root@pcdev1:~# condor_hold xiaoge.wang

Couldn't find/hold all of user xiaoge.wang's job(s).

2013-Aug-26 12:21:10 by pfc:
Can this be made optional? There are definitely instances where we might want qedits to be logged. (In fact, anytime it's not needed for scalability I'd prefer to leave them logged, since classad changes can be important for understanding the life of a job after the fact.
